heading: infoseek exec faces sex charge
subheading: an infoseek executive has been arrested for allegedly propositioning a teen-age girl in an online chat room. authorities say patrick naughton was actually sending messages to an fbi agent.
author: wired news report
text: an infoseek executive has been arrested for investigation of soliciting sex with a teen-ager over the internet, the us attorney's office in los angeles announced saturday. fbi agents arrested patrick j. naughton of seattle at the santa monica pier on thursday, thom mrozek, a spokesman for the federal prosecutor, said saturday.an affidavit filed in federal court alleged that naughton, 34, who oversees disney's go network, relayed lewd messages to a male fbi agent posing as a 13-year-old girl in an online chatroom, the los angeles times reported saturday.naughton, who was released friday, is scheduled to be arraigned 12 october."we are deeply shocked and disturbed by this. we're looking into the matter," infoseek spokeswoman terrie prosper told the new york times.calls seeking comment from buena vista internet group in burbank and walt disney in burbank were not immediately returned.disney acquired a stake in infoseek last year and the two jointly created the go network portal. in july, disney announced plans to acquire all of infoseek.
